abstract.t: This specification defines representations enabling the Standards for Pairing Frinedly Curves to be used for JSON Object Signing and Encryption (JOSE) and CBOR Object Signing and Encryption (COSE) messages.

section.title: Introduction
section.t: This specification defines algorithm encodings and representations enabling the Standard Pairing Frinedly Curves to be used for JSON Object Signing and Encryption (JOSE) [RFC7517] and CBOR Object Signing and Encryption (COSE) [RFC8152] messages. The elliptic curve and associated algorithm are registered in appropriate IANA JOSE and COSE registries.

section.title: Notational Conventions
section.t: The key words "MUST", "MUST NOT", "REQUIRED", "SHALL", "SHALL NOT", "SHOULD", "SHOULD NOT", "RECOMMENDED", "NOT RECOMMENDED", "MAY", and "OPTIONAL" in this document are to be interpreted as described in BCP 14 RFC 2119 RFC 8174 when, and only when, they appear in all capitals, as shown here.

section.title: Bn462G1 Curve JOSE Key Representation
section.t: The pairing friendly elliptic curve "BN462" which uses the largest prime-order subgroup of E(GF(p)) is represented in a JSON Web Key (JWK) [RFC7517] using these values: o "kty": "EC" o "crv": "Bn462G1" plus "x" value to represent the curve point for the public key.

section.title: Bn462G1 Curve COSE Key Representation
section.t: It is represented in a COSE_Key [RFC8152] using these values: o "kty" (1): "EC1" (TBD - requested assignment 7) o "crv" (-1): "Bn462G1" (TBD - requested assignment 9) plus "x" (-2) values to represent the curve point for the key.

section.title: Attribute Description
section.t: Brief description of the attribute (e.g., "Message Type").

section.title: Change Controller
section.t: For Standards Track RFCs, list the "IESG". For others, give the name of the responsible party. Other details (e.g., postal address, email address, home page URI) may also be included.

section.title: Specification Document(s)
section.t: Reference to the document or documents that specify the parameter, preferably including URIs that can be used to retrieve copies of the documents. An indication of the relevant sections may also be included but is not required.
